publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1426 Mr Andrew Welsh: Arbroath Football Club-That the Parliament notes the recent confusion over reports that Arbroath Football Club's world record feat of a 36-0 victory had been surpassed; welcomes the fact that the Red Lichties' 115-year-old record remains intact; further notes that John Petrie scored 13 goals in that game, a feat which also remains an individual record for the number of goals scored by a single player in one match; recognises the great achievement of these two records, and hopes that the chants of "36-0, 36-0" will live on at Gayfield for many years to come. Supported by: Richard Lochhead*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-1426 Arbroath Football Club (lodged on 5 December 2000) Alex Johnstone*

S1M-1426 Mr Andrew Welsh: Arbroath Football Club-That the Parliament notes the recent confusion over reports that Arbroath Football Club's world record feat of a 36-0 victory had been surpassed; welcomes the fact that the Reid Litchies' 115-year-old record remains intact; further notes that John Petrie scored 13 goals in that game, a feat which also remains an individual record for the number of goals scored by a single player in one match; recognises the great achievement of these two records, and hopes that the chants of "36-0, 36-0" will live on at Gayfield for many years to come. Supported by: Richard Lochhead, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Alex Johnstone
S1M-1426 Arbroath Football Club (lodged on 5 December 2000) Michael Russell*, Colin Campbell*
S1M-1426 Arbroath Football Club (lodged on 5 December 2000) Irene McGugan*, Fiona McLeod*

Supported by: Richard Lochhead, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Alex Johnstone, Michael Russell, Colin Campbell, Irene McGugan, Fiona McLeod
